messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): and you type in some text
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): and then the script changes it to type=checkbox
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): opera and mozilla say "on", safari says whatever you typed, IE says you can't change the type.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:29): setting .value when type=checkbox causes the value attribute to change?!?!?!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:30): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: You obviously forgot to leave your sense of logic at the door.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:30): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: What's happening about Anolis, BTW?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:31): i checked it in last night
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:32): no email on the list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:33): probably was too long and hit the limit
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:33): Like, almost every line changed, I expect.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:33): Now, what need I do to get a special thanks (:)?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:33): (I mean, why do you think I did this anyway)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:34): bert didn't get special thanks either :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:34): Yeah, but most of what you did about that was complain about its speed :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:36): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/html5/ ‚Äî the TOC list has the ol numbers :(
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:40): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Should I send a email to the list saying IDs are completely different now?
10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (03:45): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I don't see the craziness in the value attribute changing when the value property is changed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:46): 10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc: the value attribute doesn't change when the value property is changed for any other type value
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:46): 10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc: normally the value content attribute maps to the defaultValue DOM attribute
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:51): man this really screws things up
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:54): hm, at least this is scoped to the input element
10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (03:55): out of curiosity, are most attributes in html5 defined to reflect or not reflect
10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (03:56): i really must learn to type at some point.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (04:19): changes topic to 'WHATWG (HTML5) -- http://www.whatwg.org/ -- Logs: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/ -- Please leave your sense of logic at the door, thanks! -- a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 had green hair, photos coming soon :-)'
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:23): the weird situation with .value, .defaultValue and value="" is kind of weird and pretty suboptimal
